overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a strong social media presence across multiple platforms, with a total follower base of 3,580. Engagement is particularly strong on LinkedIn, where academic and professional updates resonate well with the audience. The content shared frequently addresses topics related to social media research and computational methods, attracting considerable interactions in the form of likes, comments, and reposts.

contentThemes.description: Posts focusing on research findings, methodologies, and grants related to social media.
Content related to job postings and research opportunities in computational social science.
Announcements and preparations for participation in academic conferences.

recommendations: Increase the frequency of posts related to research findings and professional opportunities to maintain high engagement.
Expand the audience by engaging more with followers on platforms with lower engagement, such as Mastodon.

platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon engagement is moderate, with research updates generating interest. Increasing interaction with followers here could boost engagement.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is the most engaging platform, with professional announcements and research grants capturing significant attention.
platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows potential with steady engagement on research publications and conference participation posts.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
Just published our new paper on coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms!
